Module jtrim.image.transform
Package org.jtrim2.image.transform

Class AffineTransformationStep

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.image.transform.AffineTransformationStep
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageTransformationStep
public final class AffineTransformationStep extends Object implements ImageTransformationStep
Defines an ImageTransformationStep transforming an image based on an affine transformation.

This AffineTransformationStep defines the offset so, that (0, 0) offset means that the center of the source image will be transformed to the center of the destination image.

If you don't already have the image but know its dimension, you may use one of the declared static methods (taking both the size of the input image and the size of the destination) to calculate the coordinate transformation applied by this transformation.

Thread safety

Instances of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent and calling them while holding a lock should be avoided.
See Also:
  • getTransformationMatrix(AffineTransform, double, double, double, double)

  • Constructor Details

    • AffineTransformationStep

      public AffineTransformationStep(BasicImageTransformations transformations, Color bckgColor, InterpolationType interpolationType)
      Creates a new AffineTransformationStep based on the specified BasicImageTransformations.
      Parameters:
      transformations - the BasicImageTransformations to be applied to source images. This argument cannot be null.
      bckgColor - the Color to set the pixels of the destination image to where no pixels of the source image are transformed. This argument cannot be null.
      interpolationType - the interpolation algorithm to be used when transforming the source image. This argument cannot be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

  • Method Details

    • getTransformationMatrix

      public static AffineTransform getTransformationMatrix(BasicImageTransformations transformations)
      Creates an affine transformation from the given BasicImageTransformations.

      This method will assume that the top-left corner of the image is at (0, 0) and the bottom-right corner of the image is at the (width - 1, height - 1) coordinates. The transformations will be applied in the following order:

      1. Scaling: Multiplies the coordinates with ZoomX and ZoomY appropriately.
      2. Flips the image if specified so. Vertical flip is equivalent to multiplying the Y coordinate with -1, while horizontal flipping is equivalent to multiplying the X coordinate with -1.
      3. Rotates the points of the image around (0, 0). Counterclockwise, assuming that the x axis oriented from left to right, and the y axis is oriented from bottom to top. Notice that this is different from the usual display of images.
      4. Adds the specified offsets to the appropriate coordinates.
      Notice that if you translate the image (before applying the returned transformation) so, that the center of the image will be at (0, 0) the center of the image will be at the offset of the specified transformation.
      Parameters:
      transformations - the BasicImageTransformations from which the affine transformations are to be calculated. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the affine transformation created from the given BasicImageTransformations. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified argument is null

    • getTransformationMatrix

      public static AffineTransform getTransformationMatrix(BasicImageTransformations transformations, double srcWidth, double srcHeight, double destWidth, double destHeight)
      Creates an affine transformation from the given BasicImageTransformations object assuming the specified source and destination image sizes.

      The offset is defined so, that (0, 0) offset means that the center of the source image will be transformed to the center of the destination image.

      Parameters:
      transformations - the BasicImageTransformations to be applied to the image. This argument cannot be null.
      srcWidth - the assumed width of the source image in pixels
      srcHeight - the assumed height of the source image in pixels
      destWidth - the assumed width of the destination image in pixels
      destHeight - the assumed height of the destination image in pixels
      Returns:
      the affine transformation from the given BasicImageTransformations object assuming the specified source and destination image sizes. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified BasicImageTransformations is null

    • isSimpleTransformation

      public static boolean isSimpleTransformation(BasicImageTransformations transformation)
      Returns true if for the given transformation, the nearest neighbor interpolation should be considered optimal.
      Parameters:
      transformation - the BasicImageTransformations to be checked. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      true if for the given transformation, the nearest neighbor interpolation should be considered optimal, false if other interpolations may produce better results

    • getTransformationMatrix

      public static AffineTransform getTransformationMatrix(AffineTransform transformations, double srcWidth, double srcHeight, double destWidth, double destHeight)
      Creates an affine transformation from the given AffineTransform object assuming the specified source and destination image sizes.

      The offset is defined so, that (0, 0) offset means that the center of the source image will be transformed to the center of the destination image.

      Parameters:
      transformations - the AffineTransform to be applied to the image. This argument cannot be null.
      srcWidth - the assumed width of the source image in pixels
      srcHeight - the assumed height of the source image in pixels
      destWidth - the assumed width of the destination image in pixels
      destHeight - the assumed height of the destination image in pixels
      Returns:
      the affine transformation from the given BasicImageTransformations object assuming the specified source and destination image sizes. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified AffineTransform is null

    • render

      public TransformedImage render(CancellationToken cancelToken, TransformationStepInput input, BufferedImage offeredBuffer)
      Applies the rendering defined by this ImageTransformationStep. This method should usually apply the transformation on the image produced by the previous transformation step (i.e.: input.getInputImage()).

      If this transformation is the first in the sequence, then the input for this transformation is the same as the source image.

      Callers of this method may provide a BufferedImage which this method may use to render its output to. Implementations are free to ignore the offered BufferedImage but for best performance, they should use it instead of creating a new equivalent buffer. Note however, that they must not retain a reference themselves to this buffer after the render method returns.

      Specified by:
      render in interface ImageTransformationStep
      Parameters:
      cancelToken - the CancellationToken which might signal, that the result of this rendering is no longer needed. If this rendering process can take for more than a few hundred milliseconds, implementations are recommended to check for cancellation. This argument cannot be null.
      input - the input for this transformation. If you want to further transform the output of the previous transformation, then you should use input.getInputImage(). This argument cannot be null.
      offeredBuffer - the BufferedImage which implementation might use to render their output to. This method is free to ignore this argument. If implementation chooses to render its output to this BufferedImage, it should also return offeredBuffer in its result. This argument can be null, in which case implementations are forced to create a new BufferedImage as needed.
      Returns:
      the output of the transformation which will be the input for the next transformation; or if there is no more transformation, the actual output of the rendering chain. This method may never return null. The pointTransformer property of the result must be relative to the result of the previous transformation step and not to the original source image.

    • getTransformations

      public AffineTransform getTransformations()
      Returns the affine transformations specified at construction time. That is, the affine transformation this AffineTransformationStep applies to input images.
      Returns:
      the affine transformations specified at construction time. This method never returns null and modifying the returned transformation will have no effect on this AffineTransformationStep.

    • getBackgroundColor

      public Color getBackgroundColor()
      Returns the background color specified at construction time. That is, the color used to fill the images not covered by the transformed input image.
      Returns:
      the background color specified at construction time. This method never returns null.

    • getInterpolationType

      public InterpolationType getInterpolationType()
      Returns the interpolation type specified at construction time. That is, the type requested to be used when resampling the image when applying the affine transformation.
      Returns:
      the interpolation type specified at construction time. This method never returns null.

      Returns the string representation of this transformation in no particular format

      This method is intended to be used for debugging only.
